diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Persistent cough, mild shortness of breath on exertion.
diagnosis.baselineStatus: ECOG 1 (Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory)
diagnosis.pftSummary: FEV1 70% predicted, DLCO 65% predicted. Borderline surgical candidate, patient declined surgery.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with concurrent Chemotherapy
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing RLL primary tumor and involved hilar/mediastinal nodes (N1) with margin.
treatmentPlan.detailedConcurrentChemo: Carboplatin AUC 2 + Paclitaxel 45 mg/m^2 weekly x 6-7 cycles - Managed by Dr. Rickman
medications: Cough Syrup (e.g., Tessalon Perles) PRN radiation-induced cough

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine on wingboard with arms up, immobilized in BodyFix vacuum bag. 4D-CT acquired with respiratory tracking. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV Contrast likely used for delineation (typical practice)
ctSimulation.ctNotes: 4D-CT acquired with respiratory tracking. Tumor/Nodes motion assessed. Data acquired for 3D-CRT planning.

dosimetry.isoCoords: e.g., L+2.0, P+5.0, S-4.5 (relative to reference)
dosimetry.constraints: Spinal Cord Max < 45 Gy; Heart V30 < 40%; Total Lung V20 < 30%
dosimetry.planNotes: 3D CRT for locally advanced NSCLC. Motion managed with ITV approach on 4D-CT.

fractions.setupNotes: CBCT for initial setup verification. Match to ITV volume.
fractions.sideEffects: No acute side effects after Fx 1.
fractions.notes: Patient tolerated first treatment and concurrent chemotherapy well.

imagingAndReports.summary: 4.5 cm mass RLL abutting the pleura. Enlarged right hilar and subcarinal lymph nodes.

reportDetails.findings: A 4.5 cm mass is identified in the right lower lobe, abutting the posterior pleura. Enlarged right hilar (1.5 cm) and subcarinal (1.8 cm) lymph nodes are present, concerning for metastatic involvement.
reportDetails.impression: Right lower lobe mass with hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy, highly suspicious for locally advanced lung cancer.

imagingAndReports.summary: Hypermetabolic RLL mass (SUV 11.2). Avid hilar and mediastinal nodes. No distant mets.

reportDetails.findings: Intense FDG uptake in the 4.5 cm right lower lobe mass (SUVmax 11.2). Avid uptake in right hilar lymph nodes (SUVmax 7.8) and subcarinal lymph nodes (SUVmax 6.5). No evidence of distant metastatic disease.
reportDetails.impression: Hypermetabolic primary lung malignancy with FDG-avid hilar (N1) and mediastinal (N2 - subcarinal) lymph node metastases. No distant metastases identified. Consistent with Stage IIIA disease.

reportDetails.specimen: Bronchoscopy Biopsy, Right Lower Lobe Mass
reportDetails.microscopicDescription: Sections show bronchial mucosa and fragments of tumor composed of malignant glands infiltrating fibrous stroma. Tumor cells show nuclear atypia and mitotic activity. Immunohistochemical stains (pending) may further classify.
reportDetails.comment: Findings are diagnostic of adenocarcinoma. Recommend correlation with molecular testing results (EGFR, ALK, PD-L1 etc.) if performed.

imagingAndReports.summary: 4D-CT acquired with respiratory tracking. Motion assessed. Immobilized in BodyFix bag, arms up.

reportDetails.setup: Patient positioned supine on wingboard with arms up, immobilized in BodyFix vacuum bag. Respiratory motion assessed using RPM system.
reportDetails.scanParams: 4D CT dataset acquired from supraclavicular fossa through upper abdomen using 3 mm slice thickness. AIP and MIP reconstructions generated.
reportDetails.motionAssessment: Primary tumor and involved nodes demonstrate respiratory motion, primarily superior-inferior (approx. 1.5 cm for primary).
reportDetails.notes: Patient tolerated procedure. Tattoos placed. Data sent for 3D-CRT planning incorporating motion via ITV.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Alan Rickman (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt referred for Stage IIIA NSCLC Adeno. Borderline surgical candidate, declines surgery. Discussed definitive concurrent chemoRT (Carbo/Taxol + RT 66Gy). Plan reviewed w/ Rad Onc. Toxicity profile reviewed. Pt agrees.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Jenkins (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Reviewed case cT3N1M0 NSCLC Adeno. Agreed w/ Med Onc plan for concurrent chemoRT. Discussed RT details (3D-CRT, 66Gy/33fx), motion management (4D/ITV), potential RT side effects (fatigue, cough, esophagitis, pneumonitis). Pt agrees. 4D Sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Physics/Dosimetry
progressNotes.summary: 3D-CRT plan completed (AP/PA + obliques) using 4D-CT ITV approach. Dose constraints met for spinal cord, heart, lungs, esophagus. Plan approved by Dr. Jenkins.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Alan Rickman (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient receives Cycle 1 Carbo/Taxol. Pre-meds given. Labs reviewed. Toxicity discussed.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Jenkins (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 10/33 fx. Mild fatigue. Intermittent cough, managed with Tessalon Perles. No esophagitis yet. Tolerating chemo/RT well. Continue plan.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Jenkins (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt c/o moderate throat/chest soreness when swallowing (Grade 2 esophagitis). Started Esomeprazole. Cough increased slightly. Fatigue moderate. Labs show low WBC/Plt, discussed w/ Med Onc re: chemo dose/schedule. Continue RT. Monitor closely.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Definitive treatment with curative intent using concurrent chemoradiation.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Fatigue (very common), cough, shortness of breath, esophagitis (difficulty/pain swallowing), skin irritation/redness in treatment area, nausea/vomiting (chemo), diarrhea (chemo), low blood counts (chemo - risk of infection/bleeding), hair loss (chemo), potential long-term risk of radiation pneumonitis or esoph stricture.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Reporting fever/chills, significant pain, worsening SOB, difficulty swallowing. Skin care instructions (mild soap, moisturizers). Importance of hydration and nutrition.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT/weekly chemo, weekly labs, report symptoms promptly, maintain nutrition/hydration.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Importance of anti-nausea meds with chemo, PRN meds for cough/esophagitis. Adherence to chemo schedule.

cptCharges.description: Radiation treatment delivery, >1 MeV; complex / intermediate
